case_vignette: A 26-year-old man presents to the behavioral health clinic for assistance overcoming his fear of public speaking. He has always hated public speaking. Two weeks ago, he was supposed to present a research project at school but had to leave the podium before the presentation. He recalled that his heart was racing, his palms were sweating, and that he could not breathe. These symptoms resolved on their own after several minutes, but he felt too embarrassed to return to college the next day. This had also happened in high school where, before a presentation, he started sweating and felt palpitations and nausea that also resolved on their own. He is scheduled for another presentation next month and is terrified. He states that this only happens in front of large groups and that he has no problems communicating at small gatherings. Other than his fear of public speaking, he has a normal social life and many friends. He enjoys his classes and a part-time job.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I feel extremely afraid of speaking in front of many people, and last time I tried, my heart started racing, my hands were all sweaty, and I had trouble breathing.
How old are you?
I am 26 years old.
Do you have a history of anxiety or panic attacks?
Yes, I've had similar feelings during public speaking in high school where I would start sweating and felt my heart beat really fast along with feeling sick to my stomach.
Do you have any family history of anxiety or panic attacks?
The case vignette does not provide information about my family history.
Understood. Have you been diagnosed with any other mental health conditions?
No, I haven't been diagnosed with any other mental health conditions.
Are you currently taking any medications?
The vignette doesn't mention me taking any medications.

Thank you for the information. Based on your symptoms and history, it appears that you may be experiencing social anxiety disorder (social phobia).
**Final Diagnosis:** Social anxiety disorder (social phobia)
